main event: A round, white object with red flames coming from the bottom was observed in the sky over Thibodaux, Louisiana on May 13, 1964.
interesting points: The object was first observed on May 13 and was seen every night thereafter when the weather was clear.
The object was observed for 3-5 minutes and disappeared after flying in a straight line at 45 degrees elevation and 310 degrees azimuth.
The observer used a telescope to observe the object, which was described as being the size of a pea.
The object did not make any sound.
The Air Force was unable to detect the object on radar or confirm any scheduled aircraft in the area at the time of the sightings.
sighted object: round, white object with red flames
